definition: to rob/to plunder/to seize by force/to coerce/calamity/abbr. for kalpa 劫波[jie2 bo1]
to hold/to grasp/to support/to maintain/to persevere/to manage/to run (i.e. administer)/to control

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: Local officials say the abductors had links to al-Qaeda.
sentences.chinese: 当地官员表示，劫持者与基地组织有联系。

sentences.english: We advised the hijackers to surrender themselves to the police.
sentences.chinese: 我们劝那些劫持者向警察投案。

sentences.english: The spokesman said that the so-called "war abductees" issue does not exist.
sentences.chinese: 发言人说，所谓“战时被劫持者”问题根本不存在。

sentences.english: Media coverage of his brother being taken into custody further agitated the hostage-taker.
sentences.chinese: 媒体对其弟弟被拘捕的报道进一步激怒了劫持者。

sentences.english: Hostages and hostage takers trapped by seige, and some surprising things unfold.
sentences.chinese: 人质和劫持者被围困，然后意想不到的事情发生了。

sentences.english: Today, she informally represents the views of many of the former hostage-takers.
sentences.chinese: 今天，她简单转述了许多其他以前劫持者的观点。

sentences.english: Pictures of the 19 hijackers are also on display along with some of their passports.
sentences.chinese: 和19个劫持者照片一起展出的还有他们的部分护照。

definition: to kidnap/to hijack/to abduct/to hold under duress
